text.p: Mexican stocks recovered from an early dip to broach the 5,200-point barrier for the first time ever in early dealings Wednesday.
Dealers said foreign buyers returned to the market, encouraged by a rebound on Wall Street and as yields on U.S. long bonds eased.
The leading IPC share index was up 19.24 points, or 0.37 percent, at 5,202.26..
"The market rebounded because there is a lot of foreign cash flowing in, they turned the tap back on, and that is basically what we are seeing," a floor trader said.
The U.S. 30-year Treasury bond was up 1/32 to yield 6.49 percent, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average was up 34.84 at 8,222.38 points.
Trading volume improved from an indifferent start to 28.3 million shares.
